Three guitars are used in the song.

Guitar 1- acoustic 6-string
Guitar 2- electric 6-string overdrive(mostly!!! but also switches to metal in some parts)
Guitar 3- Bass

Solo 1:
I first thought that this has been played using a Mandolin or a 12-string guitar. But 
actually you can play it even using a 6-string guitar. You just have to play the notes 
fast enough to create the sound. You can even use the chorus mode to play this.
Here is how you do it:

e-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
B---0---3-3-3-----5----7-7-7----5---3----2-2---5---3---2---0-0---2---0--------|
G-----------------------------------------------------------------------2-----|
D-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
A-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
E-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
bhaag bhaag bhaag bhaag

e------------------------------------------5----3----2-----------------------|
B--0-0-0---3-3---5---7-7-7-7----5---3---5--------------5-5-5---7---5---3p2---|
G----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
D----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
A----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
E----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
bhaag bhaag bhaag bhaag

e----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
B---0-0-0----3-3-3-3---2--2--3-2---0-----------0h2--2--0-0---2---0-----------|
G---------------------------------------2-2--------------------------2-------|
D----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
A----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
E----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
hey hey hey hey hey heeeey

e------------------------------------------5---------------------------------|
B--0-0-0----3-3-3----5/7-7-7-7---5--3--5--------7h8-5h7---3h5---2h3---0h2----|
G----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
D----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
A----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
E----------------------------------------------------------------------------|

One of the most romantic Bengali songs ever made...Lyricist of this song is Rudra 
Mohammad Shahidullah..He was the husband of Taslima Nasrin..& this song is thought of to be a 
suicide note of Rudra for her wife Taslima..A splendid composition

Key:C#
Place capo on fret 1 and play..
Strum: Simple down strokes on the chord or D-DUD-DUD slow tempo coz the song itself is 
slow ..finger style or arepeggios can also be played to enrich..arpeggios more effective 
if played on the last line of each stanza..
